results.title: Evolutionary biology
results.creator_credit: Bruce J. Russell, Biomedia Associates and Coronet Instructional Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Biological sciences”.
This film presents the salient points of modern evolutionary theory, stressing the role of mutation and sexual reproduction in producing variation within populations. Also examines theories of natural selection and random mutation as explanations of environmental adaptation.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bruce J. Russell, Biomedia Associates and Coronet Instructional Films

results.title: Molecular biology
results.creator_credit: Bruce J. Russell and Coronet Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Biological sciences”.
An examination of the DNA based molecular control system. Investigates the primordial origins of DNA, the master molecule of life, and the structure of proteins, fats and carbohydrates. Also discusses current theories of how DNA is organised into chromosomes which store and transmit vast amounts of genetic information. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels

results.title: Behavioural biology
results.creator_credit: Bruce J. Russell and Coronet Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Biological sciences”.
Looks at behaviour patterns and their relationship to brain and nerve cell circuits. Shows that behaviour can be both inherited and adaptive by examining simple forms of behaviour in single celled organisms. Also presents an inquiry that culminates in an open-ended analysis of some aspects of human behaviour.

results.creator_credit: David Tippit, Jeremy Pickett-Heaps, Tom Soranno and Cytographics Productions

results.title: Challenging years
results.creator_credit: David E. Barrow, Peter Fletcher, Stanley Hawes, Motion Picture Associates and New South Wales Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Shows how some elderly men and women have planned for retirement. Illustrates, with dramatic vignettes, the positive and rewarding aspects of this period of life, and warns of the pitfalls to be avoided.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David E. Barrow, Peter Fletcher, Stanley Hawes, Motion Picture Associates and New South Wales Film Corporation

results.title: Cell 16
results.creator_credit: Martin Duckworth, Colin Low and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Filmed at Collins Bay Penitentiary, Kingston, Ontario, this is a portrayal of the effects on the individual of incarceration. Prisons, the film shows, lock men in themselves, depriving their minds of normal life experiences, confiscating their humanity. Music - Eugene Grandmond and The Fifth Dimension. Voice and narration by Jim Morrison.

results.title: Chairmen = L Age de Chaise
results.creator_credit: Jean Bedard, Gaston Sarault and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An allegory of contemporary society, this animation film shows a society where man has lost his freedom in the struggle to wrest recognition from the very society that is restricting his freedom. The chair is the symbol of success. Without a chair, man is a social outcast. Highly critical of our way of life and modern society, the film questions the present and the future. Complex and innovative animation techniques emphasize the message. A film without words. (Awards: Annecy; Oberhausen; Chicago)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jean Bedard, Gaston Sarault and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Cesaria Evora
results.creator_credit: Anais Prosaic, Eric Mulet, Gerard Lacroix, Gerard Pont, Jean-Paul Guillemard, La Sept-Arte and Morgane Production
results.brief_description: Documentary on singer Cesaria Evora, born in the port town of Mindelo on the Cape Verde island of Sao Vicente - a former Portuguese colony off the north-west coast of Africa. Evora (born 1941) has brought the unique sounds of her birthplace, known as ‘morna’ - a slow, rhythmic song form that is a mix of blues, jazz and Portuguese folk - to world attention. Her magnificent voice and soulful singing is often accompanied by the acoustic sounds of guitar, cavaquinho, violin, accordion, and clarinet, in a expressive, lyrical style. Evora’s music conveys the struggles of her people and melancholy of their history. In this work Evora is interviewed in her home town and discusses her upbringing, early musical experiences, being a single mother, unexpected fame and remarkable life. Features interviews with family and friends and performances by Evora and other local musicians and singers in various cafes and bars. Internationally, Evora is known as the ‘barefoot diva’ for her propensity to appear on stage in bare feet. This DVD also includes a live concert of Evora’s from 1995.

results.title: Cesar's bark canoe
results.creator_credit: Bernard Gosselin, Paul Larose and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Building a canoe solely from the materials that the forest provides may become a lost art, even among the Indians whose traditional craft it is. In this film, Cesar Newashish, a sixty-seven-year-old Cree Indian of the Manowan Reserve north of Montreal, builds a canoe in th old way, using only birch bark, cedar splints, spruce roots and gum. With a sure hand he works methodically to fashion a craft unsurpassed in function or beauty of design. The film is without commentary but text frames appear on the screen in Cree, French and English. Award: New York
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bernard Gosselin, Paul Larose and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Cerveau gele
results.creator_credit: Pierre Moretti, Rene Jodoin and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Claude Dubois sings out against the petrifying effect of growing cities. The images on the screen form and reform to reflect his sentiments. Music by Claude Dubois and photography by Claude Lapierre.
